function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Blockchain technology may not be effectively integrated with other technologies like AI and big data, leading to inefficiencies in pandemic control.","Impact":"Ineffective pandemic control, resulting in a higher spread of contagious diseases and increased mortality rates.","Mitigation":"Ensure seamless integration and interoperability of blockchain technology with AI, big data, and Cloud computing to optimize pandemic control efforts.","Technologies":"Interoperability solutions, data standardization, and API development for seamless integration.","People":"Healthcare professionals, technologists, and policymakers involved in pandemic control efforts.","Owner":"Technology companies, government agencies, and international health organizations."},{"Description":"Inadequate customization of ledgers for local servers in outbreak areas may limit the effectiveness of blockchain technology in optimizing pandemic response.","Impact":"Reduced performance of blockchain technology in outbreak areas, leading to challenges in data verification and communication.","Mitigation":"Develop and deploy customized ledgers for local servers in outbreak areas to enhance blockchain performance and optimize pandemic response.","Technologies":"Customized blockchain ledger development, distributed database design, and server optimization for low-latency data processing.","People":"Local healthcare authorities, IT professionals, and infrastructure management teams in outbreak areas.","Owner":"Blockchain technology developers, IT service providers, and local healthcare authorities."},{"Description":"Lack of integration of blockchain technology with ethical data standards may compromise user privacy protection and lead to ethical concerns.","Impact":"Privacy breaches, ethical implications, and public distrust in pandemic control technologies, leading to resistance and non-compliance with control measures.","Mitigation":"Implement and adhere to ethical data standards, encryption protocols, and privacy regulations in the design and deployment of blockchain technology for pandemic control.","Technologies":"Privacy-enhancing technologies, encryption algorithms, and decentralized identity management solutions.","People":"Data privacy experts, policymakers, and public health advocates advocating for ethical use of health data.","Owner":"Blockchain technology developers, regulatory authorities, and public health organizations."}]}
